docs.lead_paragraph: As Washington debates the best way to avert an economic meltdown, increasing numbers of Americans are struggling with another financial crisis: the growing burden of unpaid medical bills.

headline.main: Health Care Costs Increase Strain, Studies Find
headline.print_headline: Health Care Costs Create Rising Strain, Studies Find

docs.snippet: As Washington debates the best way to avert an economic meltdown, increasing numbers of Americans are struggling with another financial crisis: the growing burden of unpaid medical bills.

docs.lead_paragraph: PRIME-TIME SPEECH President Bush, warning of ''a long and painful recession,'' appealed to the nation to support the $700 billion plan to rescue Wall Street. He invited both major presidential candidates and Congressional leaders to the White House to forge a compromise. The bailout plan has stirred Americans' anger in e-mail -- jumping off the screen in capital letters and exclamation points -- to lawmakers in Washington. [A25.]
docs.snippet: PRIME-TIME SPEECH President Bush, warning of ''a long and painful recession,''  appealed to the nation  to support the $700 billion plan to rescue Wall Street.  He invited both major presidential candidates and Congressional leaders to the White...

docs.lead_paragraph: While Americans are debating whether the bailout plan helps Wall Street or Main Street, non-Americans have been debating how the proposed bailout plans will affect the rest of the world. Why would anyone outside the United States care about what might seem like a very domestic issue?

headline.main: Why the World Cares About the U.S. Crisis

docs.abstract: A few ways the international community might be affected by the Wall Street crisis and the possible bailout solutions.
docs.snippet: A few ways the international community might be affected by the Wall Street crisis and the possible bailout solutions.

docs.lead_paragraph: More than 750,000 adults in New York are at increased risk of heart attack or stroke because they have high blood pressure that is not under control, according to a study released Wednesday by the city's Department of Health and Mental Hygiene. The study found that 26 percent of New Yorkers have high blood pressure -- slightly less than the national average of 30 percent.

headline.main: 750,000 in City Have Dangerously High Blood Pressure

docs.abstract: Of the 1.5 million adult New Yorkers who have high blood pressure, also known as hypertension, 53 percent do not have the condition under control, a 2004 survey found.
docs.snippet: Of the 1.5 million adult New Yorkers who have high blood pressure, also known as hypertension, 53 percent do not have the condition under control, a 2004 survey found.

docs.lead_paragraph: The federal government will provide disability pay, lifetime health care and death benefits for all veterans with Lou Gehrig’s disease, which has been linked to military service.

headline.main: Veterans Gain U.S. Benefits for Lou Gehrig’s Disease
headline.print_headline: Veterans Gain U.S. Benefits for Lou Gehrig’s Disease

docs.snippet: The federal government will provide disability pay, lifetime health care and death benefits for all veterans with Lou Gehrig’s disease, which has been linked to military service.

docs.lead_paragraph: Congress moved close to approving a bill that would require health insurance plans to provide treatment of mental illnesses comparable to what they already provide for physical illnesses.

headline.main: Congress Backs Parity in Coverage of Illnesses
headline.print_headline: Congress Backs Parity In Coverage Of Illnesses

docs.snippet: Congress moved close to approving a bill that would require health insurance plans to provide treatment of mental illnesses comparable to what they already provide for physical illnesses.

docs.lead_paragraph: CLEARWATER, Fla. - Senator Barack Obama this afternoon urged Treasury and Federal Reserve officials to include four conditions that he and other Democrats are seeking in the proposed $700 billion federal bailout for financial firms - though he stopped short of saying he would vote against the bailout if his terms were not met.

headline.main: Obama Says Bailout Should Include 4 Conditions

docs.abstract: Senator Barack Obama said that if the conditions are not met, he would recommend that federal and Congressional negotiators "go back to the drawing board" to restructure the bailout plan.
docs.snippet: Senator Barack Obama said that if the conditions are not met, he would recommend that federal and Congressional negotiators "go back to the drawing board" to restructure the bailout plan.

docs.lead_paragraph: Credit-default swaps used to inhabit an arcane corner of Wall Street. Now, they are fast becoming part of the national vocabulary because of the role they have played in the government's decisions to bail out certain financial firms.

headline.main: S.E.C. Chair: Regulate Credit-Default Swaps Now

docs.abstract: Credit-default swaps used to inhabit an arcane corner of Wall Street. Now, they are fast becoming part of the national vocabulary because of the role they have played in the government's decisions to bail out certain financial firms. Christopher Cox, the chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, urged Congress on Tuesday to pass a [...]
